data.title: How Did Sri Lanka Fix Its Economy
data.meta_description: A year and a half ago, I wrote about Sri Lanka’s debt crisis. Back then, Sri Lanka was experiencing both economic and governmental collapse. The catalyst was a high debt load as well as COVID…
data.text:
Like all debtors who invest too much in non-productive and crappy assets, for years Sri Lanka had been struggling to service its debt. And unfortunately the solution it came to was more debt! Sri Lanka used increasing amounts of debt (at increasingly higher interest rates) to pay back the interest and principal of previous loans and kept digging itself into a deeper and deeper financial hole. It was still able to borrow because pre 2019, its tourism sector was still booming and it was still reasonably flush with foreign exchange reserves.

Then came COVID which basically completely shut down its tourism driven economy. This put tremendous pressure on its finances as spending to support its economy and people increased at the same time as tax revenues plunged.
